sentence.idiomatic: That place is too out of the way; the transportation is so inconvenient.
The place you are talking about is a little bit out of the way; I may not be able to find it.
He was born in a remote mountain village. When he was young, his dream was to go live in the big city.
I haven't been back for a few years, and it's become really lively here. I remember it was really desolate here before, with no people around.
What is there to do in the desert? It's so desolate, and all there is is a bunch of sand.
Although I am walking on this bustling street, my heart is actually desolate and lonely.
It's pretty good that young people today are able to be so self-sufficient.
Even though I don't make as much money as you, at least I am self-sufficient; not like you who has to ask for money from home every month.
That sort of self-sufficent mode of production from before is already outdated. What we are pursuing now is the market economy.
If you continue to close yourself off and not interact with the outside world, you will get more and more lonely.
Single mothers are faced with a lot of pressures from the outside world.
My own matters are most clear to me; I don't care how the outside world views them.
Since he retired he hardly leaves the house, and doesn't pay attention to the outside world. He really just lives a solitary life.
Due to living in long-term solitude, this tribe has retained an ancient way of life.
I'm fed up with the noise of the city. I really want to find a solitary place to begin a secluded life.
Having an operation is really hard on your body. You need to take some more tonics.
Ah, these past few days staying up all night studying for the exam is really sapping the life out of me.
The departure of a few outstanding members of the team has really hurt their vitality. In the short term it will be very difficult for them to achieve their former standard.
I've heard that many boats have gone missing in that part of the sea.
Recently a lot of children have gone missing from this area. Parents are all very concerned.
I finally found that book that had been missing for a long time.
No one has heard anything from him lately. It's like he's vanished of the face of the earth.

word.literal: to vanish of face of earth

sentence.idiomatic: One day I'm going to plan my own disappearance and see who really cares about me.
It's really strange, I never withdrew money. How could the money in my bank account suddenly vanish?
How could the the documents I saved in the computer disappear? Someone must be playing a trick on me.
You must be careful of him. He loves to play tricks on people behind their backs.
What are you trying to pull? You tricked me into coming here just to see this?
Ah, we're finally in Jizhou! It's really heaven on earth here. Look, the Himalayas are right before us!
I've never breathed such fresh air before. Look how blue the sky is, and how especially close, as if you could stretch out your arm and touch it.
Jizhou is just the right name for this place. It's so remote and desolate. It's completely unaffected by modern society. And now we can get a feel for ethnic minority life.
Don't forget we also have to explore the Kongluo people's mysterious culture. Even now they're still self-sufficient, and don't have contact with the outside world.
Hey, are you guys here traveling?
Yes, are you too?
My name is Jiayan. I have my own hostel.
Oh, that's great! I'm Zhao Lu. Hi!
I'm Fang Jianming.
It's a good thing we ran into you. Otherwise we really wouldn't know what to do.
Madam, you opened a hostel on your own in such a solitary place. That's impressive.
What's impressive about it? I just live day to day. Let's chat as we walk. The hostel isn't far.
We're there. You must be tired from the trip. Go get some sleep. This is the room key. By the way, be sure not to take a shower. It will weaken your vitality. Do you want me to send dinner up?
No need to go to the trouble. We'll get up on our own and come eat.
So we'll go to our room now. Jiayan, thanks!
Ah? What was that noise? A flute?
Huh? There's no sound. You must be tired, and a little confused.
I didn't hear it either. Let's go up.
I definitely clearly heard the sound of a flute...
Good morning, Jiayan. Is Jianming in the dining room?
Who? Didn't you come alone?
What? I came yesterday with a guy! You two even spoke to each other.
You definitely came alone. I didn't see anyone else.
What are you saying? Someone else disappeared?
Who are you? What do you mean, ``disappeared?" Have people disappeared before?
My name is Xu Wentao. I too came here traveling with my girlfriend three years ago, and she vanished from this world. I come back every year to look for her.
Jiayan, what are you trying to pull? How could you not remember Jianming? I don't believe it. I'm going out to look for him right now. Jianming! Jianming!

word.literal: a stranger in a strange place
